Content-type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-transfer-encoding: 7BIT

Note: This mail contains the stack trace and I've attached the order.xml file too 

I'm running J2RE 1.4.2 IBM on SuSE Enterprise Server V.9
The job ends right away and all my log files are 0 bytes


----- Original Message ----- 
  From: stack 
  To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, August 08, 2005 8:15 PM
  Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix 1.4 can't launch job - Fatal InitializationException


  Charles Foetz wrote:

  > Hello fellow crawlers,
  >  
  > At Luxembourg's national library we're taking our first steps in 
  > crawling. I'm looking at this myself at the moment, I've managed 
  > to successfully crawl, store, search, retrieve and display some sites 
  > as a prototype, using H1.2 for the crawling part. When I installed 
  > H1.4 a month ago, it didn't work and I assumed an interference issue 
  > with 1.2 (an environment variable or something), but after a new clean 
  > server installation (re-installing SuSe Enterprise 9 and then H1.4) I 
  > get the same error as soon as I try the first default job (using one 
  > seed, having set the "user-agent" and "from" fields correctly):
  >  
  > Symptoms:
  >  
  > - The job completes almost as soon as it starts,

  This sounds like this issue: 
  http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#windowsstart.  Do you have your own 
  wrapper script starting up Heritrix or are you using stock 
  $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix?

I don't use any wrapper script, I start it with 

export HERITRIX_HOME=/usr/local/heritrix-1.4.0/
$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix -p 8084

(I've also tried without the -port option and ran it on 8080 - same results)

  > - "No statistics associated with job" in the reports
  > - No page is crawled or archived (specified arcs folder isn't even 
  > created)
  > - on the Jobs tab under "Completed jobs" I read "Could not launch job 
  > - Fatal initializationException - A fatal InitializationException 
  > occured when loading job:Unable to setup crawl modules: 
  > java.lang.NullPointerException: Reference Queue cannot be null".

  May we see the full stack trace for the exception?  Might give us a clue 
  (Is this being done on an NFS mount?  If so, try running on a local disk).

Here's the stack track:
----------------------------------
----------------------------------

Unable to setup crawl modules:
java.lang.NullPointerException: Reference queue cannot
be null

Associated Throwable: java.lang.NullPointerException:
Reference queue cannot be null

  Message:
    Reference queue cannot be null

  Stacktrace:
java.lang.NullPointerException: Reference queue cannot
be null
at java.lang.ref.Reference.(Reference.java:226)
at
java.lang.ref.PhantomReference.(PhantomReference.java:72)
at
org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap$PhantomEntry.(CachedBdbMap.java:463)
at
org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap$SoftEntry.(CachedBdbMap.java:497)
at
org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap.put(CachedBdbMap.java:378)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier.getQueueFor(BdbFrontier.java:475)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier.sendToQueue(BdbFrontier.java:349)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier.receive(BdbFrontier.java:338)
at
org.archive.crawler.util.BdbUriUniqFilter.add(BdbUriUniqFilter.java:265)
at
org.archive.crawler.util.BdbUriUniqFilter.add(BdbUriUniqFilter.java:224)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier.schedule(BdbFrontier.java:321)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.loadSeeds(AbstractFrontier.java:412)
at
org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier.initialize(BdbFrontier.java:244)
at
org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.setupCrawlModules(CrawlController.java:572)
at
org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.initialize(CrawlController.java:336)
at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJobHandler.java:1050)
at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler$2.run(CrawlJobHandler.java:1016)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:567)


  >  
  > What am I missing? Does any part of the job initialzation differ 
  > signigicantly from H1.2?
  >  

  I'd doubt you're missing anything.  1.4 should run just like 1.2.
  Yours,
  St.Ack

  > Any ideas or hints greatly appreciated.
  >  
  > Charlie
  >

--Boundary_(ID_5iGcJn2jOXYckzcqXRcA1Q)
